boardgame.description:
Túlélők Földje doesn't have a commercially available rulebook, if a new player would like to start playing it he only needs to apply for a rulebook and he gets it by mail (nowadays either snail mail, or email).

Nonetheless this is the gamebooklet which was used in 2002.

From the back of the Booklet:
Először is szeretnénk megköszönni, hogy leveleddel, jelentkezéseddel már megszavaztál némi bizalmat a játékunknak. Ettől kezdve végig tegeződni fogunk, de nem azért, mert ezt a játékot csak fiatalabbak játsszák - egyszerűen azért, mert a közös hobbijú, játszani szerető emberek, a mindnyájunkban meglevő homo ludens számára ez a természetes. A játékba mindenki bekapcsolódhat, nemre és korra való tekintet nélkül (hm..., azért egy alsó korhatár létezik, hiszen ez jóval bonyolultabb, mint egy átlagos társasjáték), Az egész játékról a következő oldalakon részletes leírás következik, de azok számára, akik nincsenek még otthon a szerepjátékok egyre népszerűbb világában, talán nem árt egy egészen rövid ismertető. Ezt az egészen újfajta játéktípust, amely annyira alapvető kategória, mint a kétszemélyes játékok, vagy a sportjátékok kategóriája, csak húsz évvel ezelőtt találták ki. A játék egyik alapvető újdonsága, hogy a játékosok nem egymás ellen játszanak, nem egymás elpusztítására törekszenek, hanem képzeletbeli ellenfelekkel küzdenek meg, egymást segítve. Ez persze eddig majdnem ugyanaz, mint egy számítógépes játék. Ezekben az ún. szerepjátékokban azonban a játékos egy részletesen kidolgozott személyiséget alakít, amelynek tulajdonságai, képességei fokozatosan fejlődnek, és ezáltal egyre keményebb kihívásokkal nézhet szembe. Ez egyrészt a szinte végtelen változatosságot, másrészt az igen gyakori sikerélményt biztosítja. A játékos minden újabb játékban ugyanazt a karaktert alakítja, így minden tárgy, tudás, tapasztalat, amit egy korábbi alkalommal szerzett, felhasználható később is.

boardgame.name: Charta Krymenesiae
boardgame.description:
The Krymenesian Charter was proclaimed. Thirty-five fearless sea monsters were given the task of protecting the wilderness of the Krymenesian Waters. For years and centuries no creature has had the courage to venture into Krymenesia — until now when the ocean's most feared animals, the orcas, decided to take it over.

In Charta Krymenesiae, you must turn the sea monsters into your allies, use their powers, take over territories, and close off one of the opponent's whales from the open sea to become the King of the Sea.

You can either challenge a single opponent to an amazing intellectual battle, or join a friend so that you can outmaneuver your opponent as a team and conquer the Waters of Krymenesia. No one to play with? The game includes 48 puzzles to offer you a solitaire challenge in which you have to explore territories that'll remind you of nautical symbols.

The expansion was part of the limited print for the "Stadt Land Spielt"- Event on September 14th 2014 taking place all over Germany.

This is a promo tile for Istanbul, the award winning board game. It replaces the regular fountain tile and has the same function as the Kebab Shop promo, but with different graphics, showing the Sprudelhof, an Art Noveau spa ensemble in Bad Nauheim, near the home of Pegasus in Friedberg. It was given away at the Pegasus supporter meeting at the Sprudelhof.

Note: this promo is produced on card stock rather than the thick cardboard used for the original game tiles.

boardgame.name: Village: Customer Expansion 2
Village: Die zweite Kundenerweiterung
boardgame.description:
Village: Customers Expansion II is exactly what the name describes – another four additional customers that can be added to the Village base, inn and port game. Here's what those customers need in order to be served:


Tile 1, The Beggar: Just pay 2 money and take the beggar. At the end of the game, you score 5 prestige points.
Tile 2, only with Village Inn: Spend a beer. At the end of the game, you score 1 prestige point for every villager card that shows a burned down candle.
Tile 3, only with Village Port: Sell a treasure chest you brought home but have not turned into money. At the end of the game, you score 7 prestige points.
Tile 4: Spend 2 green influence cubes to score 3 prestige points at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Hometown Story
boardgame.description:
Hometown Story (ホームタウンストーリー Hōmutaun Sutōrī) is a 2013 life-simulation video game for the Nintendo 3DS created by Harvest Moon creator Yasuhiro Wada, developed and published by Toybox Inc. and distributed by Natsume for North America and Rising Star Games for Europe.

The main character is in charge of running a shop inherited from their deceased grandmother. The player is capable of arranging and stocking the shelves of their shop to their preference and can eventually expand on the size of the shop. In a similar vein to the Harvest Moon series the player is able to interact and befriend various townspeople. The town that the player resides in will consist of ten people at first and eventually build its way to one hundred non-player characters that the player can meet depending on their actions over the course of the story.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hometown Story", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Derro
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:



Stare Into the Void!

Staring into the void, the derro are waiting in their twisted cities to oversee the descent of the world into insanity and destruction. But a few of them seek a wider realm...

The strange little derro are an unlikely choice for player characters (and this supplement provides much fuel for NPC anti-paladins and savants!), but they can be a wonderful change of pace in any underdark campaign or any game with a wide scope.

Advanced Races: Derro gives you everything you need to play one of these subterranean dwarves who has seen too much, starting with derro PCs abilities, culture, quirks, and richly expanded Pathfinder RPG rules. This 19-page sourcebook includes:

Racial stats for lesser and full Derro PCs, plus 8 alternate racial traits from Vermin Speaker to Beloved of Madness
3 extremely metal new spells: Facemelt, Madfire, and Skullsplitter!
Complete Minor Madness tables
5 new racial feats, plus derro gear such as poisoned nets and strange magical items
Includes Age and Weight Tables, plus suggested names for your derro PC or NPC!
3 archetypes including Fist of Madness (Monk) and Shadow Antipaladin, plus the Derro Savant bloodline


It's all here, pick up Advanced Races: Derro today, and see beyond the walls of sanity!

boardgame.name: Dino Bash
boardgame.description:
Dino Bash is a short, but fun game first published in Roleplayer Independent (Volume 1, Issue 6 - May 1993).

The game is simple board game, designed to provide a little light relief between role-playing games scenarios.

The game is based in a world where Dinosaurs have never died out. There are three fractions, The Carnivores, The Herbivores and The Mammals.

The game takes places in the bar; The Jurassic Arms (A3 map provided with counters) and two six sided dice are required (miniatures could be useful).

Each character has a simple profile which consists of three basic attributes; Wounds Points, Action Points and Combat Points, but also description on how they attack and any special attractions.

There are a number of special items counters which the characters can pick up around the bar to help them.

Each fraction has a background which gives the player what’s they needs to do in the game.
